bug.author: qiaoruiyt
bug.summary: Trainer auto_lr_find flag cannot be set to boolean through argparse
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
It seems that the Trainer auto_lr_find flag can only be set to str type via argparse. If it is not a boolean, Trainer will seek the finder with variable name defined via --auto_lr_find instead of using the default lr_finder. It's not a big issue as we can work around this by some processing after parsing the arguments. However, I hope the auto_lr_find flag can be set in a better way as it may cause trouble for people who don't know about this. Thanks! <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
This works: python train.py trainer = pl.Trainer(gpus=args.gpus, auto_lr_find=True) This will have error because of the string type: python train.py --auto_lr_find True parser = pl.Trainer.add_argparse_args(parser) args = parser.parse_args() trainer = pl.Trainer.from_argparse_args(args) <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
0.8.4

comments.comment:
on flags like this or for example fast_dev_run we should set the action="store_true" in the argparser. Not sure how hard this is to implement. Then we can just do <denchmark-code>python train.py --auto_lr_find </denchmark-code>
but <denchmark-code>python train.py --auto_lr_find True </denchmark-code>
is definitely not the desired way, but you can currently use "1" instead of "True"
Thanks for the help! It sounds okay if "1" would work for the case.
